become lazie effoeminate long ease disvse armes vnder roman government vnable withstand fury scot picts pressing vpon great violence north earnest suite new legion sent emperour honorius roman much lord confederate enimy beaten backe meanes perswasion hereof better advantage exclude forragers fourth trench wall turfes raised vpon neere vnto wall lollius vrbicus betwixt two sea edenborough westerne empire miserably languishing drawing towards last period distressed briton destitute roman succour although teares much importunity desiredrepellunt barbari ad mare repellit mare ad barbaros compendium imperatore valentini • primo malmesburiensem de gestis regum anglorum henr huntingd hist lib 8 hectoris boethij histor scotorum georgij buchanani rerum scoticarum hist camdeni britanniam de pictis name hereof signifyeth painted latine tongue first giuen vnto roman regard painting picts accustomed paint themselues authority claudian quae scoto dat fraena truci ferro que notatas perlegit exangues picto moriente figura • claudia de bello getico andscoti intellige pictos nomen habent à picto corpore eò quod aculeis ferr • cum atramento variarum figurarum stigmate annotentur isidori hispal episc orig lib 9 isidore make manifest pompoinus laetus buchanan others would haue haue beene colonie opposite neighbouring german nation wee reade tacitus classique authour ever haue beene painted beda much better authority fetcheth pedegree scythian arriue northerne part iland yeare 78 christ yet doth constantly affirme delivereth onely receiued tradition errour hereof like forreine derivation generall consent auncient geographer historian doth plainely evince placing caledonii name briton mentioning picts vntill two hundred yeares afterwards probable assertion natiue briton inhabiting wilde part caledonia afterneque vestis vsum britanni cognôrunt sed ventrem atque cervicem ferro incingunt ornamentum id esse ac diuitiarum argumentum existimantes perinde vt aurum caeteri anglosaxonibus german people mentioned tacitus ptolemy contayning part great populous nation suevi ptolemy placeth time middle vast interiores autem atque mediterrancae gens maximè sunt angili sueui qui magi orient • le sunt quam longobardi protensi ad septentrionem vsquè ad medium albis fluvij ptolem geog lib 2 c 11 continent riuer albis riuer bounded vpon north towards west people longobards inhabited probably according discription part lie bishopricke hall higher saxony wittenberg interpretation seeme absurd regard affinity name would haue seated engerne westphalen angloen pomerania place farre distant river elb heart germany afterwards towards waine romane empire flitted german ocean westward beda invasion iland placed betwixt iutes lying vpon north saxon vpon south vnite westsaxon kingdome miserably wasted rage cruelty withred brother edric son egbert succeeding seauen year vacancy yeare 693 good leaue ina king westsaxons successour ceadwalla whose peace vpon north river thames eastsaxons vpon west kingdome westsaxons named thus situation thereof lying southerne part iland begun ella saxon captaine arriuing new dutch supplyes time hengist king kent first monarch english concerning exact time ellaes descent hither english authours doe much vary want auncient direct notwithstanding part agree hapned time hengist 200 yeares continuance long oppression mightie king westsaxons state took end subdued king ina incorporated vnion westsaxon kingdome neither kentish although first kingdomes erected saxon yet came growth bad neighbourhood westsaxons mercians potent dutch intruder comming betwixt briton king ella aforesaid arriving yeare 477 afterflores hist per mat westmonast zenone imperatore mat westminister sent hengist year afterwards hauing vanquished briton sundry fight sacked strong city anderida chiefe fortresse yeare 488 taking vpon name authority king part hengist attained soueraigntie chiefe commaund rest saxon widdow father ethelwolf married death hapned shortly bauldwin first earle flanders deceasing brother ethelbert remained sole king english ethelbert sonne ethelwolf decease ethelbald sole monarch england ethelred first king england brother ethelbald ethelbert troublesome raigne hereof advantage warres dane eastangles shake yoake english monarch creating holy edmund king martyred hungar hubba two danish captaines succeeded vnto prince merciles pagan nation stout resistance many battails fought last slaine dane alfrid king england fourth sonne ethelwolf brother three preceding king great valour amongst vertues vnparaleld matchles prince altogether vanquishing yet repressing furie raging vnconquerable dane threatning vtter destruction english nation brought low ebbe long restles invasion frequent victory depopulation tyranny founded rather renewedv asser meneven auncient aud renowned vniversity oxford first parted land shire tithings hundred deceasing yeares 901 edward surnamed elder king england son alfred made subject eastangles other▪ part possessed languishing droping dane excepting northumberland held yet prince natiō athelstan king englād son edward twise vanquished fight constantine king scot assisted irish subdued briton cumberland remainder dane inhabiting northumberland made welsh tributary confined cornish within river tamar present bound greatest victorious english monarch time deceasing yeare 940 edmund first king england son edward brother athelstan dane northumberland revolting againe brought vnder annexed province immediate government also quite ouerthrew kingdome briton cumberland killing two son dummailus last king whose country hee gaue vnto malcolme first king scotland condition homage english crowne defence northerne part danish intruder edred king england son edward brother athelstan third time tamed brought vnder ever restles rebellious dane northumberland edwy king england son edmund first prince nothing gratious subject ouerthrowne rooted gothes vandal also gentile time first entrance commerce acquaintance gothes vnder king gensericus turned arrian christian departing long afrique suevians first likewise gentile vnder third king receiarius yeare 448 receiued christian catholique faith shortly subdued restored gothes sweyed greatnes nation vnder king remismundus changed arrian heresie raigne theodomyrus apostacy aboue one hundred yeares returned againe vnto catholique beliefe wherein continued vntill extirpation kingdome name gothes andeca last king gothes arrians first entrance roman province corrupted valens emperour east continuance time becomming lord whole spaine rest barbarous nation roman subdued subiected continent vnder foule heresy vnder king ricaredus yeare 588 reiecting arrian first embraced orthodox tenent whole spaine againe become catholique persisted vntil expiration name monarchy hereof rodericus yeare 714 raigne prince hapned fatall invasion moore whereby country almost moment time became overwhelmed new mahumetane superstition religion confined within mountaines biscay asturia long fierce warres aboue space 700 yeares kingdome granado last retraite taken ferdinand fifth isabel king castile aragon infidel beaten home afrique province totally recovered vnto christian beliefe time may rightly esteemed christian corrupted long popish imposture although since part reformed part christendome hath full impurity beene maintained vnto day religion allowed romish church without visible shew mixture especial cause hereof besides vnnaturall stiffnes nation easily changing hath beene inquisition extreamest diligence watchfulnesse still crushing religion shell protestant bookes freer discourse commerce vtterly prohibited taking away meanes attayning light canigo name distinction find ronceval branch second row hill coasting westward along shoare sea cantabrique overspreading country guipuscoa biscay asturia vntill galitia devide middest thenerium neighbourhood vnto sea guipuscoa biscay asturia part galitia part spaine lying north hereof betwixt ocean called natiues country beyond mountaines eminent top hereof mountaine mon adriani vasaei brugensis chron st adrian situated high roade baione france cut middest easie passage traveller whose top vasaeus brugensis reporteth saw cantabrian mediterranean sea craggie hill towards head riuer ebro proceedeth third ridge running directly south city burgos taradona daroca length end mediterranean litle west fall riuer ebro whole aunciently ptolemyidubeda stra geog lib 3 ptol l 2 c 6 strabo euxinus lying vpon west ostrogothes paulus diaconus addition eutropius otherwise beginneth name raigne emperour valens king fridigernus concerning see ostrogothes isidore continueth history onely king athanaricus preceded alaricus kingdome vnder king alaricus raigne honorius emperour west first descended italy taking sacking city rome vnder athaulfus succeeded alaricus marrying vnto galla placidia sister honorius entring league confederacy roman leaving italy gaule narbonensis given vnto inhabite part spaine tarraconensis catalonia condition keepe roman empire serue vnder pay hereof vnder walia gelderland wearyed long sicknes burthen great empire voluntarily surrendred estate vnto younger brother ferdinand son philip second cloistering himselfe vp monastery st iustus estremadura private fortune dyed philip second son vnto emperour charles fift lord kingdomes possession belonging house burgundy spaine german empire dominion austria left vnto vncle ferdinand sebastian king portugal slaine afrique moore battaile alcacar vncle cardinall henry long surviuing great captain ferdin̄d alvares de toledo yeare 1580 cōquered kingdome first monarch spaine since king rodericus gothes giue checke vnto sudden overgreat prosperity lowcountries time revolted eight whose richest province holland zealand vtreicht overysel gelderland zutphen westfreisland groninghen haue armes freed themselues spanish yoake subjection philip third son philip second succeeding dominion conquest spaine netherlands assigned father vnto sister isabella marryed vnto albert archduke austria philip fourth son philip third king castille spaine many province subject great empire hereof kingdome navarra thev ioannem marianam de rebus hisp hist despaigne par loys de mayerne histor de navarre par andre fauyn kingdome hereof first begun amongst pyrenean mountaines part whereabout standeth towne suprarbe vascones naturall inhabitant rather certaine remnant shipwrackd flying christian great invndation moore retreating amongst safer rock shelter hereof exact time begun set downe onely thus much agreed vpon garcias ximinius first king dyed yeare 758 42 yeares first erection kingdome asturians leon first entituled kingdome suprarbe chiefe towne mountainous part afterwards tooke name navarra probably vnder innicus garcias time first descending mountaines former king kept themselues immurd tooke pampelona plaine countrey moore raigne sanctius great earledomes castille aragon annexed king hereof seazed whole biscaia olava navarra old castille part aragonia prince castille aragonia againe devided navarra giuen title king son ferdinand ramir encroachment ferdinand first alfonsus eight king castille townes nagera calahora logrogno part navarra betwixt riuer ebro monte doca lopped herefrom joyned name accompt castille biscaia olava likewise afterwards rent meanes finde overmatched potent neighbour king castille aragon interveening betwixt moore barred enlarging dominion continent crossing pyrenaean mountaines france marriage alliance house kingdome prince hereof severall time became possessed earledomes champaigne brie foix begorre soveraigne lordship bearn dukedome eureux albret vendosme lastly mighty kingdome france shut spaine armes castillian navarra king ferdinand fift heires house day onely enjoye kingdome hereditary whereof woman issue capable prince hereof garcias ximinius first king suprarbe deceasing yeare 758 garcias innicus son garcias ximinius fortunius garcias son garcias innicus sancius garcias son fortunius garcias ximinius garcias son sancius garcias died without heires last king suprarbe house first garcias ximinius interregnum 4 yeares innicus garcias surnamed arista earle begorre elected yeare 840 conquered pampelona champian countrey moore whose time probably kingdome tooke name navarra garcias innicus son innicus garcias arista king navarra voluntarily resigned kingdome turned religious fortunius son garcias innicus right garcias dying sans issue became possessed castille yeare 1028 deviding dominion gaue castille vnto younger son ferdinand ramir naturall son aragonia vnto title king garcias de nagera eldest son sanctius great succeeding rest dominion house navarra prince tainted vnnaturall wickednes mother wrongfully accused adultery kingdome navarra continually languished never prospered daily encroached vpon neighbouring king castille aragon lastly iohn albret wrested posterity hereof added province castille sanctius garcias son garcias de nagera slaine treason brother raimund without surviuing issue raimund bro • vnto sanctius garcias enjoyed long kingdome expu • sed presently vsurpation sanctius ramir king aragon navarra son ramir first king aragon brother garcias de nagera peter first king wise succeeding yeare 1194 vntill prince space aboue 500 yeares kingdome navarra beene still continued line masculine decease sans issue first fell right woman transported ouer mountaines france borrowed king england whose eldest sonnes borne prince wale brought hither meanes marriage catharine daughter iohn gaunt duke lancaster vnto henry son iohn first vpon occasion entitled thus father aragonia country seemeth continuate garden field regard mild temperature heauens garnished yeare long sweetsmelling flowres miraculously euerywhere abounding pomegranate limons delicious fruitetrees otherwise corne yeeldeth plenty might suffice inhabitant sheepe heere beare finest fleece thorough whole spaine relate breed cotteswould england transported continent raigne ferdinand fift inhabitant imposture french sieur du haillan natiue frenchman plaine history france life pharamond freely acknowledging word cannot bee vnderstood kingdome pharamond never made law perpetuall male succession haue much law custome begun first barbarous race king reverenced law second third race better authority thereof falsely called name salique attributed vnto pharamond hee addeth neither aimonius gregory tour auncient approved french historian ever make mention law remarkeable thing beene would haue omitted manifest law haue bin fained either du haillan philip le long put barre vnto title competitour kingdome descended isabel daughter philip fourth father lewis hutin philip le long ever since hath observed hath bin rather avoide exception english haue reason authority prince stiled ferdinand fift witheld spaniard greater cause 〈◊〉 fr • declining hereof haue beene 1 improvident devision french empire son emperour lewis godly whereby gaule france within rhijn became parted diver lesser seigneuryes italy germany quite rent herefrom kingdomes honour title roman emperour translated forraine stranger family 2 monstrous alienation many chiefer province hereof graunted former king bare reservation homage vnto themselues meanes great dukedomes aquitaine guienne bretaigne normandy burgundy earledomes champaigne provençe others contayning aboue one halfe part whole france became long time free loose immediate commaund jurisdiction hereof marriage otherwise comming hand straungers well affected crowne haue much disabled great performance oftentimes turning armes hereagainst gaule narbonensis haue beene called regard civility inhabitant subjection hereof roman lawes much difference newly conquered barbarous gallia excluded author accompt gaule named v supra province rest roman province gaule invasion conquest barbarous nation taking vp new name appellation onely remained part hereof contayned betwixt rhosne alpes falling share charles son emperour lotharius became parcell kingdome burgundy afterwards person bozon first made part kingdome arles burgundy person hugh arles supposed ruby haue beene bastard son lotharius second king lorraine concubine waldrada first made earledome giuen vnto title king bozon first bee held vnder soveraignty king arles burgundy hugh arles earle provençe gift lewis son bozon becomming afterwards king arles burgundy long resigning extinct heard whether quite destroyed slaughter cruelty barbarian removed farre remote vnknowne part first ancient dwelling probably within maine land sarmatia chuni ptolemy raigne emperours valens gratian remouing thence gothes flitted vnto left shore ister thwarting vpon side pannonia thrace infesting thence long time neighbouring roman province vnder great attila seated pannonia opposite side becani originum lib 7 gotodanica beene part hun distinguished people difference surnameth aviri aulziagri vnprobably otherwise might avarini mentionedavarini juxta caput vistulae amnis pto geog l 3 c 5 ptolemy amongst sarmatae later greeke author call simply abares avaeres ancient dutch french hun avares becanus conjectureth haue beene name two different nation ioining force warres invasion became meanes promiscuously called name cause mistake historian accompting one people herein al vncertaine first certaine expresse mention greeke author finde haue beene raigne tiberius second emperour east vpon occasion certaine carpenter sent herefrom vnto misimployed building bridge danow intent transport meanes army river invade romane province afterwardes read raigne next emperour mauritius vnder hony great abundance country affordeth plentie graine regard continuall fresh newly broken ground taken wood sent downe river wijssel vnto dantzig elbing prussen thence conveyed forraine part vnexhausted treasurie storehouse corne europe west common people poore base miserable slaues gentry nobility braue high minded valiant liberall free rather superfluous gift attendance expences ranke professing armes called equites latine polish historian interpret knight souldiers differing onely greater lesser revenue magistracy office eminent sort hold tearme life conferred king pay prince tallages lieu whereof serue attend warres language sclavonian much affect elegantly speake latin religion every man best liketh sort grosse heresy publikely allowed yet suffered hath hapned great liberty nobility people weake power king confused state controule yet notwithstanding romish superstition meanes prince great zeale way day prevaileth first conversion christianity vnder prince miecislaus son nemomislus yeare 965 bishop cracow posna vladislaw v cromer de rebus polon lib 3 ploczko vnder archbishop gnesna primate kingdome ancient priviledge pope legat sarmatia absence vacancie prince vicar generall kingdome hauing power summon councel diet conclude publish decree state monarchicall electiue yet next blood royall commonly succeede king anciently free soveraigne common calamitie electiue state bereft royall right prerogatiues onely limited power governing according strict lawes direction councell diet solely haue full liberty consult determine maine affaire commonwealth two sort senate grand councell consisting bishop palatine castellans togither great marshal state court chancelour vicechancelour treasurer dominion poland lithuania many conveniently drawne togither consulted 2 generall diet high important business weale publicke determinable senate amassed order set downe delegate province chiefer citty sent name rest nobility sworne preserue publicke honour liberty speake freely councell diet oftentimes challenging reproving prince controuling action thinke prejudiciall country divided greater lesser poland greater poland distinguished thus either bigger honourable seat sometimes lechus founder polish nation containeth 9 part diuisions named thus chiefe towne iurisdiction palatinate thus called palatine country posna kalisch siradia kingdome deceasing also without issue gaue country vnto brother ladislaus first sirnamed saint successours king hungary meanes line succession prince sclavonia croatia failing king hungarie haue euer since time beene possessed right hereof vnion crowne hungarie raignes basslius alexis ioint emperours grecian murcemirus king croatia venetian vnder pietro vrceola 26 duke secure trade shipping vpon adriaticke shoare continually infested pyracies ilands curzola lezina narentines vpon continent forced armes rest townes voluntarily submitting subjected vnto empire seacoast hereof histria gulfe lost againe long venetian vnder dominico michaeli 35 duke otherwise venetian historian herein vncertaine vnder prince vitalis michaeli 38 duke afterwards bela king hungary quitteth whole right dalmatia vnto state • giacomo tepulo 43 duke king lewis first inuading dalmatia mighty armie venetian vnder 57 duke giovanni delphino vnable retaine country busied dangerous warres neerer home make peace potent enemie vtterlie abandoned quitted vnto successours prince hungary conquest hereof histria gulfe cornero vnto durazzo greece leauing title duke dalmatia till vsurped long ladislaus king naples contending emperour sigismond realme hungary sould againe deliuered vp dalmatia vnto venetian 100000 crownes others zara hauen territory thereof since time hungarian detained important warres turkes venetian became third time possessed manner whole sea coast hereof riuer arsa histria vnto border greece raignes amurath mahomet second king turkes warres hereof scanderbeg king epirots finde empire venetian haue reached eastward along shore sea adriaticke towards macedonie farre lissus alesio albania farthest extension way sclavonia illyricum mahomet second emperour turkes townes scutari drivasto alesio enthralled turkish tyranny taken venetian beyond mountaines stephen last prince thereof captivated afterwards cruelly murthered kingdome bosna part sometimes croatia held vnder fief tribute king hungary reduced since turkish province gouerned bassa succeeding turkish monarch part added empire towne ragusi belonging vnto venetian free commonwealth subiect notwithstanding tribute turkes rest illyricum sclavonia vnconquered infidel yet held venetian german emperours house austria successours king hungary whereof cōmand inland part croatia windischlandt former greatest part kingdome bosna country cold hilly mountainous yet sufficiently fruitfull stored necessary provision oppression neighbourhood turkes whose injury continually exposed hill hereof seeme bee mountaines within line drawne border macedony vnto meeting river saw danow ancientlyv blondi hist l 2 dec 2 part croatia erected afterwards wee finde petty kingdome held prince thereof vnder cheifage tribute king hungary hath vpon west croatia vpon north saw part lower hungary contained betwixt river dra vpon east servia vpon south dalmatia chiefer townes iaitza seated vpon high hill encompassed bottome two river schwonica warbosaine country seemeth containe inland part dalmatia plinie ptolemie last christian prince hereof stephen yeare 1464 kingdome taken subdued surprised afterwards inhumanely murthered mahomet second first emperour turkes country made turkish province commanded ever since bassa contado di zara thus named zara chiefe towne otherwise dominicus nigerv dom nig geog comment 6 retaineth yet proper name sclavonia containeth part liburnia ptolemie plinie extended along sea coast bound hereof mountaine ardium strabo krabbaten river arsa histria sea adriaticke riuer titius scutari scodra ptolemy antoninus scordra plinie strongly seated vpon steepe rocke place riuer boliana issueth forth lake named hence lake scutari chiefe towne country famous braue resolute siege maintained mahomet second emperour turkes lake scutari named labeates strabo containeth 130 mile compasse surrounded side mountaines saving towards north distant 18 mile sea rockie mountainous region betwixt adriaticke dom niger nameth criana craina drivesto enderum ptolemy medon nere herevnto vpon river called moraza falling lake scutari stood sometimes citty doclea ptolemy diocleadioclesianus delmata anulini senatoris libertinus matre pariter que opido nomine dioclea quorum vocabulis donec imperium sumeret diocles appellatus vbi orbis romani potentiam cepit graium nomen romanum morem conuertit sexti aurelij victoris epit impetante dioclesiano sextus aurelius victor country mighty emperour dioclesian part albania long since obeyed venetian subject turkish empire whole extent length generall accompt name dalmatia histria riuer arsa vnto alesio albania along course adriaticke matalius accompteth 480 italian mile breadth adriaticke vnto mountaines croatia 120 mile ilands dalmatia close along shoare hereof lie great multitude ilands plinie hyperbolically encreaseth number thousand whereof many notwithstanding smalnesse may rather accompted rockes ilands rest greatest part pagoissa lying nona continent name issa strabo ptolemy pliny hath towne name containeth 100 mile compasse saltworkes yeeld great profit inhabitant commonwealth venice lezina named parus pharus pharus
